title.narrative: Farmers Vs Pastoralists conflict resolution project (FPCRP)

description.narrative:
The Farmers vs Pastoralists Conflict Resolution Project (FPCRP) will be implemented in Tharkueng and Kangi Payams of the former Jur River County. The project aims to promote peaceful co-existence between the farmers (Jur River County) and the pastoralists from Warrap State who normally travel to Jur River County during the dry season (November-April) in search of water and pasture for their livestock.
During the project implementation period, the project will mitigate the conflict between farmers and pastoralists through dialogue and reconciliatory approaches. The project will use the existing Peace Building Committee members as entry points and as leverage to initiate dialogue around natural resource sharing (water and pasture) and peaceful co-existence between the farmers and the pastoralists. The use of existing Peace Building Committees and the local authorities will help the project to consolidate its resources and investments from year one and two program i.e. Human Rights and Peace Building Project while meeting the goals and the objectives of the new FPCRP in Jur River County. This project will also build on the existing structures of such as Peace Conference Resolutions especially the 2016 Marial Baai Peace Conference Resolutions/Agreements between farmers from former (WBGs) and pastoralists (Warrap State).
The people who will benefit from this project are the farmers and the pastoralists who will gain more skills and knowledge around dialogue for natural resource sharing while using their indigenous knowledge and skills for peaceful co-existence. The role of CAFOD in this project will include but not limited to provision of project funds and technical support and supervision in program development and implementation, program monitoring and coordination through field visits and establishment of linkages with other implementing partners (TOCH) in Warrap as well as directing the program towards meeting the country (South Sudan) strategic goals and objectives for peace building.
